result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert J Walker appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Robert J Walker.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is waiting on an offer. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert J Walker appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Robert J Walker.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and requests status date to determine case posture.
Case adjourned to Branch 30. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
ORAL No Contact Order with EJS.

Any cash bail on deposit to be returned to the remitter. 
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Robert J Walker in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert J Walker
Current: 3360 N 22nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States  (Effective: 08-23-2022)
Prior: 11941 West Bobolink Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($1,000.00) LW
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Robert J Walker not in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/16/2022@130
